Description: USA | JA Custom 7-String w/ EMG Active Pickup | BROWN Custom • Pickup: EMG 81-7 • Neck Construction: Neck-Through• Binding: Pearloid (Headstock/Neck/Top)• Frets: Fanned• Saddles: Roller• Truss Rod: Adjustable• Tuners: Black• Battery Compartment: 9V Tuning: B-E (440hZ) EMG 81-7 Based off the popular EMG 81, the 81-7 utilizes powerful ceramic magnets and close aperture coils to produce a detailed tone with incredible amounts of high end cut, and fluid sustain. Traditionally used in the bridge position of your seven string guitar, this pickup will make your leads slice right through even the densest mix. Additional Guitar Info Unknown Seller note: I picked this up second-hand and I am not certain of its history; I just thought it was really cool and had to have it. I can attempt to answer questions, but I‘m not real familiar with 7-stringed instruments /or this brand/model. I know it’s rare (possibly a one-off) and sounds heavy and awesome with high-gain distortion! I’m a rhythm, 6-string, rock guitarist; and, though a lot of fun, it’s not really my thing. If you’re a “metal head” — which I am no longer — this may be just what you’ve been looking for. If you’re a “shredder” who plays all over the neck, you may want a professional setup. The two-piece top is slightly separating where it was originally glued (possibly caused by climate changes,) but holding strong and no real cause for concern (see last 3 pics.) The High-E string gets caught up on the 2-3rd fret occasionally; unruly fret?
